content:
• Monday, October 22, 2012
  • HSTM

    More on HealthStream (NASDAQ:HSTM): Q3 comes up short on a per share basis, largely due to the...

    More on HealthStream (NASDAQ:HSTM): Q3 comes up short on a per share basis, largely due to the dilutive impact of its 3.6M share secondary offering during the quarter. Total sales actually increased by 28% Y/Y on sales strength in its HealthStream Learning unit and its internet-based subscription products. Shares -1.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • COHR

    Coherent (NASDAQ:COHR) +4.1% AH and P.H. Glatfelter (NYSE:GLT) +4.6% on news they will be...

    Coherent (NASDAQ:COHR) +4.1% AH and P.H. Glatfelter (NYSE:GLT) +4.6% on news they will be joining the S&P MidCap 600 as of Friday's close. Lawson Products (NASDAQ:LAWS) and soon-to-be-acquired Peet's Coffee will be removed.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • FXEN

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: FXEN +8.9%; MTW +6.7%; NLSN +6.2%; WETF +5.9%; TPLM...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: FXEN +8.9%; MTW +6.7%; NLSN +6.2%; WETF +5.9%; TPLM +5.7%.
    After-hours top losers: ODP -6.6%; RCII -5.7%; VECO -5.5%; GHL -4.4%; OEH -4.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • WDC

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) -3.6% AH after guiding on its FQ1 call (webcast) for FQ2 revenue of...

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) -3.6% AH after guiding on its FQ1 call (webcast) for FQ2 revenue of $3.55B-$3.7B and EPS of $1.65-$1.85, below a consensus of $4.13B and $2.43. Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) -4.5%. Expectations for hard drive shipments have been deteriorating as PC sales dive, but it looks as it they need to fall further still. Controller chip supplier Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL) warned last week. Seagate reports on Oct. 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM | 4 Comments
  • RCII

    Rent-A-Center (NASDAQ:RCII): Q3 EPS of $0.60 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $739.3M (+5% Y/Y)...

    Rent-A-Center (NASDAQ:RCII): Q3 EPS of $0.60 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $739.3M (+5% Y/Y) misses by $20M. Shares -5.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • MON

    The French government decides against seeking a ban on EU imports of a type of Monsanto's...

    The French government decides against seeking a ban on EU imports of a type of Monsanto's (NYSE:MON) genetically modified corn after the country's food safety agency ruled that a study linking the crop to cancers in rats was flawed and inconclusive.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM | 5 Comments
  • WCN

    Waste Connections (NYSE:WCN) declares $0.10/share quarterly dividend, 11.1% increase from prior...

    Waste Connections (NYSE:WCN) declares $0.10/share quarterly dividend, 11.1% increase from prior dividend of $0.09. Forward yield 1.25%. For shareholders of record Nov 05. Payable Nov 19. Ex-div date Nov 01. Shares +1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • VECO

    More on Veeco's Q3: Bookings fell another 18% Q/Q to $84M, with major drops in orders for both...

    More on Veeco's Q3: Bookings fell another 18% Q/Q to $84M, with major drops in orders for both LED/solar and (especially) hard drive manufacturing gear. Book-to-bill was a mere 0.66. Veeco expects Q4 revenue of $100M-$115M and EPS of $0.04-$0.16, well below a consensus of $132.3M and $0.34. VECO -7.3% AH. Rival AIXG -0.9%. GTAT, IVAC, and XRTX also bear watching. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • HXL

    More on Hexcel (NYSE:HXL): Q3 beats on the bottom line with an 11% jump in total revenue....

    More on Hexcel (NYSE:HXL): Q3 beats on the bottom line with an 11% jump in total revenue. Operating income grew 23% over the same period last year on a 150 basis point improvement in operating margins. For 2012, the company ups its EPS view to a range of $1.54 to $1.59, up from $1.45 to $1.55 per share. Sales are seen at $1.56 to $1.59B, narrower than previous projections of $1.55B to $1.65B. Shares +1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • HXL

    Hexcel (NYSE:HXL): Q3 EPS of $0.39 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $391.6M (+11.3% Y/Y) in-line....

    Hexcel (NYSE:HXL): Q3 EPS of $0.39 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $391.6M (+11.3% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • KNX

    Swift Transportation (SWFT): Q3 EPS of $0.21 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $871.1M misses by $15M....

    Swift Transportation (SWFT): Q3 EPS of $0.21 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $871.1M misses by $15M. Shares -3.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • WDC

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC): FQ1 EPS of $2.36 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $4B (+50% Y/Y) in-line....

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC): FQ1 EPS of $2.36 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $4B (+50% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO): Q3 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $1.09B (+2% Y/Y) beats by $10M. No...

    Yahoo (YHOO): Q3 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $1.09B (+2% Y/Y) beats by $10M. No guidance provided. Shares +2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 2 Comments
  • VECO

    Veeco Instruments (NASDAQ:VECO): Q3 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $126.9M (-52.6% Y/Y)...

    Veeco Instruments (NASDAQ:VECO): Q3 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $126.9M (-52.6% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares -7.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • MSN

    Emerson Radio (MSN -19.2%) falls hard after Wal-Mart pulls two of the company's microwave...

    Emerson Radio (MSN -19.2%) falls hard after Wal-Mart pulls two of the company's microwave products from its shelves. By some accounts the selloff wasn't quite as bad as expected with the company in the process of reviewing all options with its product lines after a good portion of its income looks to be lost. Street chatter points to a sum of the parts valuation as keeping shares afloat.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -3.5%) trader lower with tomorrow's Apple event looming over the...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -3.5%) trader lower with tomorrow's Apple event looming over the company like a dark cloud. Even though Apple is expected to set a higher price for its 7.85-inch tablet entry than the Nook HD, for now the risk still exists surprise features or pricing could be announced. When push come to shove, the new Nook products might be quite competitive with rival offerings, but market share on the content side is at risk with the Apple and Amazon ecosystems well-advanced.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • MTW

    Manitowoc (MTW -7.9%) shares slide after Ali Group reportedly says it isn't interested in...

    Manitowoc (MTW -7.9%) shares slide after Ali Group reportedly says it isn't interested in acquiring the company's food service distribution. MTW stock was trading at $14 on Friday before rumors of a potential sale crossed wires and drove the stock up to ~$15.20.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • OMG

    OM Group (OMG +6%) gets a boost after KeyBanc says if OMG sells its 55% stake in a Congo joint...

    OM Group (OMG +6%) gets a boost after KeyBanc says if OMG sells its 55% stake in a Congo joint venture and its Finland cobalt refinery, "this would be a catalyst for shares to move well above the current share price... in a relatively short period of time." If the deal goes through. the firm sees strong upside potential in OMG shares while the downside risk is "relatively minimal."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • LLEN

    L&L Energy (LLEN +16.2%) says it expects to complete its purchase of two new mines in China...

    L&L Energy (LLEN +16.2%) says it expects to complete its purchase of two new mines in China within the next 30 days. LLEN says the mines produce low sulfur anthracite coal with ~34.2M tons of combined coal reserves. Also, LLEN says its Weishe mine has ramped up to a rate of 150K tons/year, and plans to take it to 450K tons/year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • NOW

    ServiceNow (NOW -2.9%) slides as H-P (NYSE:HPQ) introduces cloud-based IT service desk software...

    ServiceNow (NOW -2.9%) slides as H-P (NYSE:HPQ) introduces cloud-based IT service desk software with fairly aggressive pricing - $89/month for dedicated users, $178/month for a "floating" account that's shared between users. H-P's pricing suggests a willingness to cannibalize sales as of its traditional Service Manager software in order to stem the share gains of ServiceNow and other cloud-based rivals. Citrix (NASDAQ:CTXS) entered this market last month by acquiring startup Beetil.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • SM

    SM Energy (SM -2.5%) shares aren't helped so far by Global Hunter's Buy recommendation and...

    SM Energy (SM -2.5%) shares aren't helped so far by Global Hunter's Buy recommendation and $70 price target. SM's 283K net acres in the Eagle Ford and Bakken shale plays provide "tremendous" development visibility and reliable growth over the next five years, the firm says, and SM arguably has the most irons in the fire in terms of resource play concepts it is currently testing.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • AEZS

    Shares of Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS -1%) bounce off a 52-week low before rebounding after Nasdaq...

    Shares of Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS -1%) bounce off a 52-week low before rebounding after Nasdaq notified the company that it's regained compliance with its minimum bid price rule.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • MNST

    Monster Beverage (MNST -9.7%) dives after incident reports released by the FDA cite the...

    Monster Beverage (MNST -9.7%) dives after incident reports released by the FDA cite the company's energy drink as a possible link in five separate deaths over the last few years. The agency doesn't draw any conclusions, but an increased focus on the sector seems likely.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM | 4 Comments
  • MAC

    Macerich (MAC -2.2%) shares trade lower on news of the acquisition of two New York-based malls...

    Macerich (MAC -2.2%) shares trade lower on news of the acquisition of two New York-based malls for a total of ~$1.25B as the REIT looks to expand its portfolio in the state. MAC will buy Kings Plaza, a 1.2M sq. ft. Brooklyn mall, from Alexander's (ALX +5.1%) for $751M, and will pick up Green Acres, a 1.8M sq. ft. Valley Springs mall, from Vornado Realty Trust (VNO -0.3%) for $500M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • MSFT

    Microsoft (MSFT -2.3%) heads south as a harsh Barron's column is followed up by a flurry of...

    Microsoft (MSFT -2.3%) heads south as a harsh Barron's column is followed up by a flurry of media articles related to Windows 8, some of them critical. The NY Times becomes the latest to observe many early Windows 8 users have become confused by its radical, tile-based UI. Reuters, meanwhile, joins others in noting early corporate interest in Windows 8 is limited. Gartner predicts Windows 8's PC penetration within large organizations will only reach 20% at its peak. A shift towards subscription-based licensing could buffer Microsoft a bit.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 12 Comments
  • SSNLF

    Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) says it has terminated its LCD supply contract with Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), and...

    Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) says it has terminated its LCD supply contract with Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), and will no longer provide panels to the company due to price disagreements. Rivals LG Display (LPL +2.2%), AU Optronics (AU -1%), and Sharp (OTCPK:SHCAY), who are already supplying Apple, should benefit. Apple has already shifted memory purchases away from Samsung, and reportedly wants to migrate its app processor manufacturing to TSMC. Update: A Samsung spokesman now denies the Korea Times' report.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM | 46 Comments
  • SVU

    Naming names: The picture on Supervalu (SVU +30.6%) comes into focus with Debtwire reporting...

    Naming names: The picture on Supervalu (SVU +30.6%) comes into focus with Debtwire reporting that Cerberus Capital Management wants to line up $4B-$5B in debt financing to take over the grocery store operator.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 8 Comments
  • STXS

    Midday top 10 gainers: STXS +56%. SVU +35%. CASC-OLD +18%. OTC:PGRX +14%. GURE +13%. CRMB +13%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: STXS +56%. SVU +35%. CASC-OLD +18%. OTC:PGRX +14%. GURE +13%. CRMB +13%. LLEN +12%. CHC +12%. PRWT +11%. PETS +11%.
    Top 10 Losers: OSG -63%. BSAC -62%. FSCI -29%. MSN -19%. ZN -18%. AVID -15%. HRT -6%. FDML -12%. DHRM -11%. CLWT -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • NLSN

    Nielsen (NLSN -7.3%) takes a hit today as its Q3 beat on a per share basis but disappointed on...

    Nielsen (NLSN -7.3%) takes a hit today as its Q3 beat on a per share basis but disappointed on revenue. Net earnings rose a tepid 2.9% Y/Y as the information and measurement company's watch and expositions segments' sales growth helped to improve margins, but sales in its buy segment, which offers market research for consumer firms, declined by 1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • LULU

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU -1%) slip below their 200-day moving average as last week's negative...

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU -1%) slip below their 200-day moving average as last week's negative take from Credit Suisse and a Chipotle-inspired momo scare keeps the selling pressure on. SA author Robert Broens sees more downside risk ahead with high revenue growth over the next few years needed to sustain the stock's lofty multiples. He says if LULU hits $75 again before Q3 earnings are announced, a short sale is tempting.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE +54.6%) soars to a lofty $0.19 after China's Wanxiang Group files a 13-D...

    A123 Systems (AONE +54.6%) soars to a lofty $0.19 after China's Wanxiang Group files a 13-D waiving any right to exercise warrants to purchase A123 shares, or otherwise go through with its cancelled financing deal. Last week, Wanxiang said it still wants to acquire bankrupt A123, and announced plans to outbid Johnson Controls for A123's battery business. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM | 8 Comments
  • WETF

    WisdomTree (WETF -5.9%) dives after non-executive chairman Michael Steinhardt and another early...

    WisdomTree (WETF -5.9%) dives after non-executive chairman Michael Steinhardt and another early investor, RRE Ventures, register to sell nearly 30M shares (nearly 25% of the float). The sale (not yet done) would lower RRE's stake in the company down to 0 and Steinhardt's from 25.1% to 15.9%. (S-3)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • AVA

    Avista (AVA -3.4%) shares slump after reporting preliminary Q3 EPS of $0.10 vs. $0.18 in the...

    Avista (AVA -3.4%) shares slump after reporting preliminary Q3 EPS of $0.10 vs. $0.18 in the year-ago quarter and $0.19 analyst consensus estimate. The energy company slashes its full-year guidance, citing weak results at its Ecova energy management business and losses at its other non-utility businesses.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • CHL

    China Mobile (CHL +2.7%) is rallying after posting its Q3 report, and is giving rival China...

    China Mobile (CHL +2.7%) is rallying after posting its Q3 report, and is giving rival China Unicom (CHU +1.9%) a lift along the way. A ~9M Q/Q 3G subscriber increase is going over well, as is the company's claims that its declining ARPU is stabilizing due to rising mobile data traffic. Citi is reiterating a Buy, touting CHL's 3G growth, 4% yield, and budding 4G network (still in trial stage), but expects margins to remain pressured in Q4.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • SVU

    The frenzied trading in Supervalu (SVU +28.8%) is tied in part to a note out to clients from...

    The frenzied trading in Supervalu (SVU +28.8%) is tied in part to a note out to clients from JPMorgan citing a 50% chance for a leveraged buyout. The firm's stance is that Supervalu sits as a relatively easy target with its low-cost debt and real estate assets as it upgrades the stock to Neutral from Underweight.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 3 Comments
  • CEO

    Canada’s decision to block Petronas’ bid for Progress Energy is spooking investors...

    Canada’s decision to block Petronas’ bid for Progress Energy is spooking investors in Nexen (NXY -5.5%), which awaits word on the $15B bid from China’s Cnooc (NYSE:CEO). But UBS still thinks NXY's chances of success are better because operating cash flow, capital expenditures and reserve base “are not entirely Canadian,” and Cnooc, unlike Petronas, is publicly traded, and thus more transparent.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • TXI

    Texas Industries (TXI +2.2%) trades up on an upgrade to Neutral at Sterne Agee, citing investor...

    Texas Industries (TXI +2.2%) trades up on an upgrade to Neutral at Sterne Agee, citing investor enthusiasm over a potential takeover. The firm says that perceptions are focused on possible suitors who would revive end-market demand for the company's products. Additonally, TXI was mentioned positively over the weekend in a Barron's report, saying the cement company stands to be a substantial beneficiary from any recovery in the housing market.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • BP

    BP (BP -1.6%) is considering a share buyback with part of the cash from the sale of its stake in...

    BP (BP -1.6%) is considering a share buyback with part of the cash from the sale of its stake in TNK-BP as one possible option to offset the dilution of value, but shareholders apparently wanted more than $12.3B in cash. Word on the floor is it will be hard for the stock to advance much from here due to the Macondo overhang, which could be anywhere from $15B-$25B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • AMGN

    Amgen (AMGN +1.3%) ticks up this morning following an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Deutsche...

    Amgen (AMGN +1.3%) ticks up this morning following an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Deutsche Bank ahead of its earnings report tomorrow. The firm says that despite the stock's strong move this year - from $67 in early June to its current $88 handle - it still trades at a discount to its peers and has a solid pipeline to spur continued growth. Deutsche also expects the dividend to continue to improve, and anticipates a dividend yield of 3% by 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • ZN

    Zion Oil & Gas (ZN -15.7%) shares plunge after the Israeli company said it reduced the...

    Zion Oil & Gas (ZN -15.7%) shares plunge after the Israeli company said it reduced the exercise price to $1.75 of both series of its outstanding publicly traded warrants; the original exercise price was $7 for one series and $4 for the other.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • AAP

    Advance Auto Parts (AAP -4%) says it expects Q3 revenue of $1.46B and EPS of $1.21, with both...

    Advance Auto Parts (AAP -4%) says it expects Q3 revenue of $1.46B and EPS of $1.21, with both marks falling below the estimates of analysts. Increased pending for promotions and higher store labor costs have been hitting the company's bottom line.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • PRQNF

    Petronas and Progress Energy Resources (OTC:PRQNF -11.3%) say they plan to meet with Canadian...

    Petronas and Progress Energy Resources (OTC:PRQNF -11.3%) say they plan to meet with Canadian officials to try to overturn the government's surprise move to block the Malaysian state oil company's bid. Petronas is "very serious" about proceeding with an acquisition, the country's energy minister says. "I'm sure they will do whatever needs to be done as a company."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS +3.4%) jumps after receiving an upgrade to Strong Buy from Feltl. The firm...

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS +3.4%) jumps after receiving an upgrade to Strong Buy from Feltl. The firm expects Cirrus to deliver a "beat and raise" FQ2 report (due on Oct. 29), and sees Apple's FQ4 report (due on Oct. 25) and the iPad Mini launch as positive catalysts. Cirrus obtains well over half of its revenue from Apple.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • CASC-OLD

    Japanese transportation equipment company Toyota Industries agrees to acquire Cascade...

    Japanese transportation equipment company Toyota Industries agrees to acquire Cascade (NYSE:CASC-OLD), a provider of parts for the lift trucks industry, for $759M. Toyota's offer of $65/share represents a premium of 18% to Cascade's closing price on Friday. Cascade is now +17.9% to $64.94. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • STI

    More on SunTrust (STI -3%) Q3 earnings: The sale of Coca-Cola shares netted a $1.9B pre-tax gain...

    More on SunTrust (STI -3%) Q3 earnings: The sale of Coca-Cola shares netted a $1.9B pre-tax gain vs. total income of $1.1B. Net interest margin was about flat, but loan yields are down 42 basis points Y/Y. Total loan growth of about 1% Q/Q. Tier 1 common equity ratio of 9.8%, up from 9.4% last quarter. Nonperforming loans sum to 1.42% of total book vs. 2.76% a year ago. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +4%) rallies after the The Next Web notices a job listing for linguists capable of...

    Netflix (NFLX +4%) rallies after the The Next Web notices a job listing for linguists capable of translating "marketing, UI and content materials" into "Turkish, Dutch, Hindi, German, Italian, Norwegian, Korean, and Japanese." That's fueling speculation Netflix is planning to enter some of the markets where those languages are spoken. Norwegian audiences are already covered by last week's Scandinavian launch. Netflix is now up 25% from its Sep. 25 close - Q3 results arrive tomorrow.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • SVU

    Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) climbs 25.5% higher in a slingshot move that traders say is squeezing...

    Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) climbs 25.5% higher in a slingshot move that traders say is squeezing shorts out. Close to 2M shares have already swapped hands without any M&A news of substance out, while sector peers trade flat.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • RL

    Select high-end retail stocks get clipped after VFC Corp. comes in with tepid sales for Q3 and...

    Select high-end retail stocks get clipped after VFC Corp. comes in with tepid sales for Q3 and lukewarm guidance. The company's earnings CC sent a bit of a chill through traders about Europe's luxury consumers. Decliners: RL -2.4%, COH -2.7%, PVH -1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • AVID

    Avid Technology (AVID -8.2%) crashes after warning it expects Q3 revenue of $125M-$127M, below a...

    Avid Technology (AVID -8.2%) crashes after warning it expects Q3 revenue of $125M-$127M, below a $145.2M consensus. Avid, expected to report Q3 EPS of $0.14, also forecasts a non-GAAP net loss of $3M-$5M. The company blames Americas sales execution and "transitional issues" related to plans to divest its consumer businesses. However, Avid's video production gear appears to be in a long-term decline relative to cheaper Adobe and Apple-based solutions. (Q1 warning)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • OREX

    The FDA supports exploring with Orexigen Therapeutics (OREX +4.9%) how the firm can speed up its...

    The FDA supports exploring with Orexigen Therapeutics (OREX +4.9%) how the firm can speed up its application for weight loss pill Contrave. The FDA rejected the drug in January 2011, due to possible heart problems, and asked Orexigen to conduct another study. The company has so far enrolled 7,000 patients and intends to recruit another 9,000 by the year-end. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • MM

    Millennial Media (NYSE:MM) +3.3% and OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN) +1.5% following a Reuters report...

    Millennial Media (NYSE:MM) +3.3% and OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN) +1.5% following a Reuters report claiming they're on Yahoo's (YHOO) radar. The modest gains indicate the Street isn't holding its breath over a deal going down.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • SVU

    Shares of Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) race 9.5% higher in premarket trading to reach their highest...

    Shares of Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) race 9.5% higher in premarket trading to reach their highest level in over a month. The drive upward has been buoyed by speculation on how much a bidder would pay in a buyout to take on the challenge of running the Albertsons, Cub Foods, Jewel-Osco, and Save-A-Lot food chains.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM | 4 Comments
  • TLM

    Talisman Energy (NYSE:TLM) -3.2% premarket after Canaccord Genuity downgrades shares to Hold...

    Talisman Energy (NYSE:TLM) -3.2% premarket after Canaccord Genuity downgrades shares to Hold from Buy and with a lower price target of $14.75 (from $16.50). The firm now sees TLM having a difficult time selling itself in light of the Petronas news, and TLM's "fixes itself or has to sell itself" thesis is not as attractive as it was prior to this weekend.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. futures are up but down from earlier highs after Caterpillar (-1.3%) cuts...

    Market preview: U.S. futures are up but down from earlier highs after Caterpillar (-1.3%) cuts its 2012 outlook, while European shares also lose momentum and are mixed in choppy trading. The S&P benchmark is +0.2%. Following news of M&A deals, Ancestry.com is +7.7% and BP a more cerebral +0.5%, while Peabody jumps 6.1% following its results. Later: Yahoo, Texas Instrument earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • SUPN
